title: Antibacterial Activity of Selected Standard Strains of Lactic Acid Bacteria Producing Bacteriocins – Pilot Study
Actinomycotic osteomyelitis of the mandible: review of 15 cases

items.abstract: <jats:p>We analyzed the epidemiological characteristics of pneumonia in intensive care units of Polish hospitals. Among 11,587 patients, there were 191 cases of hospital-acquired pneumonia (HAP). The incidence of HAP was 5.6%, and that of ventilator-associated pneumonia (VAP) was 17.9%. The overall mortality rate was 12.6%, and the mortality rate for patients who received artificial ventilation was 15.0%. The predominant organisms causing HAP and VAP were <jats:italic>Pseudomonas aeruginosa</jats:italic> and <jats:italic>Escherichia coli</jats:italic>, and 21.1% of <jats:italic>Staphylococcus aureus</jats:italic> isolates were resistant to methicillin.</jats:p>
title: Hospital-Acquired Pneumonia in the Intensive Care Units of Polish Hospitals
